opinion:
BOYER AGENCY, INC. v. BELETSKY, 24 Conn. App. 812 (1991) 585 A.2d 1276 BOYER AGENCY, INC. v. PAUL BELETSKY ET AL. (9301)Appellate Court of Connecticut
DALY, O'CONNELL and HEIMAN, Js.
Argued February 5, 1991
Decision released February 26, 1991
Action to recover a real estate brokerage commission, brought to the Superior Court in the judicial district of New London, where the court, Hurley, J.,Page 813 granted the plaintiff's application for an ex parte real estate attachment; thereafter, the court, Axelrod, J., granted the defendants' motion to dissolve the attachment, and the plaintiff appealed to this court. Affirmed.
Raymond L. Baribeault, Jr., with whom, on the brief, was Lloyd L. Langhammer, for the appellant (plaintiff).
Edward S. Domnarski, Jr., with whom, on the brief, was R. Scott Patterson, for the appellees (defendants).
PER CURIAM.
The judgment is affirmed.
